name: UPSC CDS (Combined Defence Services) Exam
description: A national-level competitive examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) twice a year for the recruitment of commissioned officers into the Indian Military Academy (IMA), Officers' Training Academy (OTA), Indian Naval Academy (INA), and Indian Air Force Academy (AFA).

eligibility.ageLimit: Varies by academy. For IMA & INA: 19-24 years. For AFA: 20-24 years. For OTA: 19-25 years. Candidates must be unmarried.
eligibility.educationalQualification:
For IMA and OTA: Degree from a recognized university. 
For INA: Degree in Engineering. 
For AFA: Degree of a recognized University (with Physics and Mathematics at 10+2 level) or Bachelor of Engineering.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came to India before 1st January 1962 with the intention of permanently settling in India.

timeline.examDate: September 1, 2024 (for CDS II, 2024). The exam is held twice a year, typically in April and September.
timeline.resultDate: Written exam results are usually declared within 1-2 months. Final results are declared after the SSB interviews.

examPattern.mode: Offline (Pen and Paper based, OMR sheets)

stages.name: Stage 1: Written Examination
stages.description: An objective-type written test. For IMA, INA, and AFA, it comprises three papers (English, GK, Elementary Mathematics). For OTA, it comprises two papers (English, GK).

stages.name: Stage 2: SSB Interview (Service Selection Board)
stages.description: Candidates who clear the written exam are called for a 5-day interview process which includes intelligence tests, psychological tests, group tasks, and a personal interview to assess officer-like qualities.

stages.name: Stage 3: Medical Examination
stages.description: Candidates recommended by the SSB undergo a detailed medical examination at designated military hospitals.

examPattern.markingScheme: There is negative marking for wrong answers. One-third (1/3) of the marks assigned to that question will be deducted as a penalty.

syllabus.name: English
topics: Ordering of Words in a sentence

syllabus.name: General Knowledge
topics: History of India and Indian National Movement
